faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Have questions about HARVEST FLOW? Take a look at the answers to our most frequently asked questions below.

1.question: What is the structure of the HARVEST FLOW service?
1.answer: HARVEST FLOW is a service in which we hold your crypto assets for a fixed period and return the same quantity and type of crypto assets at the end of the contract term, along with lending fees calculated at a fixed rate. It is a crypto asset lending (loan-for-consumption) service provided in accordance with Japanese law, ensuring a safe and reliable experience for our users.

2.question: How is HARVEST FLOW different from other lending services?
2.answer: HARVEST FLOW is an innovative lending service that aims to achieve both profitability and social impact by lending to real-world projects (RWAs) that aim to improve the world. We call this combination of generating stable income and contributing to society a "Social Action," which is a core mission of HARVEST FLOW in building a sustainable future.

3.question: Can I use HARVEST FLOW if I don't own any crypto assets?
3.answer: To use HARVEST FLOW, you need to hold the specific crypto asset designated in each project.

4.question: Can I cancel the lending contract before the end of the term?
4.answer: In principle, early termination is not allowed. However, since the Proof of Support is issued as an NFT, it can be traded on external marketplaces such as OpenSea or Magic Eden. While HARVEST FLOW may assist with creating collection pages or setting royalties, it does not participate in or guarantee any secondary market transactions.

5.question: How is the lending fee calculated?
5.answer:
The lending fee is generally calculated using the formula below:

Interest =  
(Quantity of the same type of crypto asset corresponding to the number of lending units) × (Lending fee rate) ×  
Seconds from the project's defined execution time to the time when the request is received from the Proof of Support (NFT) holder  
(If that time is after the project's lending period has ended, calculation is capped at the end of the lending period) ÷ (60×60×24×365)  
− Lending fees already paid by us to the Proof of Support holder

The payout frequency, timing, and fee rate vary by project. Please refer to each project page for details.

6.question: Where can I ask questions or get support?
6.answer: Please ask your questions in HARVEST HALL's Discord.

hero.title1: Driving the future of emerging countries
hero.title2: Tuktuk loan business in Southeast Asia

about.lead1: Want to earn steady returns on your dormant assets while making a positive impact? By lending your crypto, you can tap into Southeast Asia's growing microfinance market and fuel real transformation.
about.lead2: For many, a tuktuk is more than just transport—it’s a way out of poverty. You can assist tuktuk drivers in Southeast Asia access the financial services they need to own their vehicles.

col1.title: Break barriers, build financial freedom
col1.p1: Tuktuks are an essential part of the lifestyle in many Southeast Asian countries. In Cambodia, 80,000 vehicles service locals and 6 million tourists annually. Despite that, many drivers from low-income or rural backgrounds are unable to access loans to own their tuktuks due to traditional banking barriers.
col1.p2: HARVEST FLOW breaks this cycle by offering tailored loans, empowering drivers to achieve financial independence and build brighter futures.

col2.title: The power of your crypto
col2.p1: Cambodia's economy is soaring with 7% GDP growth, but rural communities are often left behind. Your investment builds the foundations for financial independence, enabling tuktuk drivers to earn up to $400 monthly—triple the average income.
col2.p2: Drivers share stories of sending kids to school and escaping poverty. By lending, you’re not just earning returns—you’re creating life-changing opportunities.
col2.p3: Real people, real assets, real markets.

col4.title: Secure lending through blockchain
col4.p1: Partnering with Global Mobility Service (GMS), a Japanese FinTech pioneer, we use IoT and cloud technology to make lending secure and impactful. The Mobility-Cloud Connecting System tracks tuktuks in real-time, while the Mobility Service Financial Platform assesses credit risk for underserved drivers.
col4.p2: Since October 2023, we've financed over 100 tuktuks in Cambodia with a near-zero default rate, ensuring your investment is safe and effective. Join a service that’s redefining mobility and finance.

1.title: Plume Tuktuks
1.description:
Plume Tuktuks is a financial inclusion project powered by the partnership between Plume Network and HARVEST FLOW.

Starting in Cambodia, the project aims to deploy a $20 million tuktuk loan initiative to continue providing access to vehicles and opportunities for economic independence through crypto lending.

Plume users can participate through a simple on-chain experience, growing their assets while driving real-world social impact.

2.title: Dour Darcels Tuktuks
2.description:
Dour Darcels Tuktuks is a social impact initiative by Dour Darcels NFT and HARVEST FLOW, based in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

The project supports a fleet of 88 tuktuks to drivers from underserved communities by providing vehicles through a lending model that helps sustain their livelihoods.

Dour Darcel NFT holders can get involved by purchasing Custom Wrap Vouchers—turning their NFTs into real tuktuk wraps. It’s a fun way to bring IP to the streets and drive meaningful impact for local drivers.

izumidaLee.name: IZUMIDA LEE
izumidaLee.bio: Born in Hokkaido in 1986. Izumida Lee began drawing at a young age and studied art while living in the United States.  In 2015, she relocated to Tokyo and launched her career as an artist in 2019. Her work primarily focuses on acrylic paintings, signboards, advertising art, and illustrations and text for window displays.

momokaIto.name: MOMOKA ITO
momokaIto.bio: Born in Miyagi Prefecture. Graduated from Tohoku University of Art & Design in 2021 with a degree in Japanese Painting. Drawing on the unique perspective and mindset cultivated through Japanese painting, they pursue free and unrestricted forms of expression. In 2022, they began exploring NFTs. While working with children at an art school, they continue to showcase their work in solo and group exhibitions both in Japan and abroad.
